Round double-precision columns

round_double_cols.Rd

When uploading a data frame to a Postgres database, there are times when numerical precision prevents compressing the table with compress_rows(). This function rounds all double precision columns (but not integer columns) in .df to the specified precision (digs) and can be called before upserting .df to the database.

Usage

round_double_cols(.df, digits = 15)

Arguments

.df

A data frame whose double-precision columns are to be rounded.

digits

The number of digits of precision. Default is 15, to ensure rows are identical for compress_rows().

Value

A version of .df with double-precision columns rounded.

Examples

data.frame(name = c("pi", "pi+1"),
  # Have to make these integers ("L")
  # so they are left alone.
  million = c(1000000L, 1000001L),
  pi = c(pi, pi+1)) |>
  round_double_cols(digits = 3)
#>   name million   pi
#> 1   pi 1000000 3.14
#> 2 pi+1 1000001 4.14
